intro: Psychotria grosourdyeana, commonly known as the Grosourdy's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in humid, shaded understory environments within tropical rainforests. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
